bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
EdgeConv implementation <denchmark-link:https://github.com/rusty1s/pytorch_geometric/blob/949f52aa9b5a9daff0d93398e57be775dc082a62/examples/dgcnn_segmentation.py#L107>line</denchmark-link> throws . <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Run file. Wait until the end of the first epoch for test(loader) call.
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
Calculation of the accuracy and IoU at the given epoch. <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
OS: Ubuntu 18.04 Python version: 3.7 PyTorch version: 1.5.0 CUDA/cuDNN version: 10.2/7.6 GCC version: 7.5.0
<denchmark-h:h2>Additional context</denchmark-h>
I'm new to the PyTorch but it seems that replacing following lines: <denchmark-code>i = intersection[j, loader.dataset.y_mask[category[j]]] u = union[j, loader.dataset.y_mask[category[j]]] </denchmark-code>
with <denchmark-code>i = intersection[j, loader.dataset.y_mask[category[j], :4]] u = union[j, loader.dataset.y_mask[category[j], :4]] </denchmark-code>
fixes crashing and give reasonable results (I'm not sure how I'm new to PyTorch). I reckon that 'Airplane': [0,1,2,3] corresponds to :4. I don't know how to generalize to make it work for list of categories.
